title: Quarantine animals infected by bird flu, Centre tells States after tiger, leopard deaths in Nagpur - The Hindu
summary:
Quarantine animals infected by bird flu, Centre tells States after tiger, leopard deaths in Nagpur

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: The Hindu

With the first case of avian influenza reported in Maharashtra, the Union Animal Husbandry Ministry is urging states to quarantine infected cats to prevent disease transmission.

  • Three tigers and one leopard died from H5N1 virus at a Nagpur rescue centre.
  • Union Animal Husbandry Commissioner confirmed it as the first reported case of bird flu in animals in India.
  • The ministry is investigating potential causes, including chicken meat fed to animals.
  • Strict biosecurity measures and temporary closures of infected establishments mandated.
  • Zoo personnel to be provided with protective equipment and health screenings.
“In Maharashtra, the case was reported from a rescue centre... The animals are in a rescue centre. Maybe the chicken meat served to them could be the reason for the disease.” - Abhijit Mitra, Commissioner

The incident raises significant health concerns, necessitating immediate action to prevent further spread of the virus.
newTitle: Centre Urges Quarantine of Animals Following Bird Flu Cases in Maharashtra

title: Roborock's New Robot Vac Has an Arm to Pick Up Dirty Socks and Underwear - CNET
summary:
Roborock's New Robot Vac Has an Arm to Pick Up Dirty Socks and Underwear

Publication Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: CNET

Roborock has introduced its latest robot vacuum, the Saros Z70, which boasts a unique mechanical arm capable of picking up small items while cleaning.

  • The Saros Z70 features the OmniGrip, a five-axis robotic arm that can lift objects up to 10.5 ounces.
  • The vacuum also has advanced navigation with next-gen sensors and AI-powered object recognition.
  • Initial demos showed some mechanical glitches, but Roborock assures that these issues have been addressed for retail versions.
  • The vacuum can detect and avoid up to 108 different obstacles during cleaning cycles.
  • Safety features include a child lock and a safety stop button to prevent accidental grabs.
"Instead of using a traditional LDS (LIDAR) tower module for navigation, the system integrates next-gen dual-light 3D time-of-flight sensors and RGB cameras powered by AI to determine its position, surroundings and whether the object it grips is overweight." - Roborock

The Roborock Saros Z70 not only innovates with its mechanical arm but also maintains strong vacuuming capabilities with 22,000 Pa of suction power and an anti-tangle system.
newTitle: Roborock Unveils Innovative Robot Vacuum with Grabbing Arm

title: Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut | Weather wrap - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave and dense fog have resulted in freezing temperatures and significantly reduced visibility across northern India, prompting widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Delhi experienced its longest spell of fog, leading to cancellations of hundreds of flights and trains due to zero visibility conditions.
  • In Jharkhand, schools will be closed from January 7-13 due to the cold wave affecting the region.
  • Kashmir saw fresh snowfall while temperatures dipped to below freezing in various areas, with Kokernag recording minus 8.1 degrees Celsius.
  • Cold and foggy conditions persist in Punjab and Haryana, affecting daily life and transportation.
  • Himachal Pradesh recorded its highest January temperature in history, with towns like Shimla reaching 22 degrees Celsius.
  • In Patna, Bihar, schools have been ordered to be closed due to intense cold conditions.
“Compared to Saturday's 9-hour zero visibility spell, Palam experienced a relatively shorter duration of 3.5 hours of zero visibility on Sunday.” - PTI

The cold wave is significantly affecting daily activities and safety, with authorities taking necessary actions to mitigate impacts.
newTitle: Cold Wave and Dense Fog Impact North India; Schools Shut in Jharkhand

  • Kejriwal's government is under scrutiny as the 2025 Delhi assembly elections approach.

title: Viral footage from China raises red flags: Could HMPV be spreading to India? - The Economic Times
summary:
Viral Footage from China Raises Concerns About HMPV Spread to India

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

China is seeing a rise in cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), prompting increased screening measures. Despite alarming social media reports, health authorities reassure the public that there is no cause for alarm.

Key Points

  • HMPV is a respiratory virus causing mild cold-like symptoms but can be severe in vulnerable populations.
  • Chinese health officials report rising cases, particularly among children in northern regions.
  • No cases of HMPV have been reported in India thus far.
  • Health authorities in India are monitoring the situation and stress that there is no alarm.
“Metapneumovirus is like any other respiratory virus that causes the common cold,” – Dr. Atul Goel, Director-General of Health Services in India.

Overall, while the rise of cases in China has raised concerns, health officials in both China and India are working to reassure the public and maintain preparedness as HMPV is typically seasonal.
newTitle: Viral Footage from China Raises Concerns About HMPV Spread to India

title: With PM Modi expected to visit Paris in February, deals to buy Rafale fighter jets, Scorpene subs for Navy reach final stage - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Set to Visit Paris as Defense Deals with France Near Completion

Published on: January 05, 2025

Source: The Hindu

India is finalizing two major defense deals with France worth over $10 billion ahead of PM Modi's expected visit to Paris for an AI summit. The deals include 26 Rafale-M fighter jets and three additional Scorpene-class submarines for the Indian Navy.

  • The expected visit by PM Modi is tied to the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit hosted by French President Emmanuel Macron.
  • The procurement includes 26 Rafale-M jets for aircraft carriers and three Scorpene submarines, set for approval by Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS).
  • Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi stated that the deals are in their final stages and could be completed soon.
  • The Rafale deal will fill a gap in naval capabilities until indigenous alternatives are ready.
  • Three additional Scorpene submarines are critical for addressing an aging fleet in the Navy.
“The expectation is that PM Modi will visit Paris to attend the AI Summit and will also have a bilateral component.”

The deals signify a strengthening of defense ties between India and France, addressing critical needs for the Indian Navy as it enhances its operational capabilities.
newTitle: PM Modi Set to Visit Paris as Defense Deals with France Near Completion

title: The happiness diet: Foods that boost your mood this winter - The Times of India
There are no HMPV cases in Andhra Pradesh, says Director of Public Health - The Hindu
summary:
No HMPV Cases in Andhra Pradesh, Says Public Health Director

Published on January 05, 2025 by IST

Dr. K. Padmavathi, Director of Public Health, confirmed that there are currently no Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in Andhra Pradesh and advised against panic over its spread.

  • The virus spreads similarly to Coronavirus, primarily affecting children, the elderly, and those with low immunity.
  • Symptoms resemble a common cold and may include cough, runny nose, and respiratory issues.
  • Precautions similar to those during COVID-19 are recommended, including self-isolation for symptomatic individuals.
  • There is no specific antiviral treatment currently available for HMPV.
“The virus spreads through droplets expelled by coughing or sneezing, close contact, handshakes, and touching surfaces.” - Dr. K. Padmavathi

Supportive care is important for those affected as government hospitals are prepared to treat those severely impacted.
newTitle: No HMPV Cases in Andhra Pradesh, Says Public Health Director

title: ‘Dinosaur Highway’ With Hundreds of Jurassic-Era Footprints Found in UK - VICE
summary:
‘Dinosaur Highway’ With Hundreds of Jurassic-Era Footprints Found in UK

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: [Source Not Provided]

In Dewars Farm Quarry in Oxfordshire, England, paleontologists have discovered over 200 dinosaur footprints from the Jurassic period, around 166 million years ago, referred to as a “dinosaur highway.”

  • The footprints belong to a mix of herbivores and carnivores, including Cetiosaurus and Megalosaurus.
  • The Cetiosaurus resembles the classic Brontosaurus, while the Megalosaurus is notably recognized as the first dinosaur to be scientifically named.
  • Professor Kirsty Edgar highlights the significance of these findings, stating they provide insight into the movements and interactions of dinosaurs in a tropical environment.
  • Modern technology has enhanced the analysis of these footprints, allowing detailed mapping and preservation, which was not possible in previous discoveries.
“These footprints offer an extraordinary window into the lives of dinosaurs, revealing details about their movements, interactions, and the tropical environment they inhabited.” - Professor Kirsty Edgar

The research aims to deepen our understanding of dinosaur behavior and the environment they lived in during the Jurassic period in England.
newTitle: Jurassic-Era Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in UK Quarry

title: HDFC Bank's LDR falls below 100% for the first time after merger - Business Standard
summary:
HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

HDFC Bank's loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) has fallen below 100% for the first time since its merger with HDFC Ltd. This decline is attributed to slower loan growth and the securitisation of a significant portion of loans in Q3 of FY25.

  • HDFC Bank’s LDR is now at 99.2%, down from 100.76% in Q2 of FY25.
  • The LDR was 111.53% in Q3 of 2023-24.
  • The decrease is in line with the bank’s guidance for more cautious loan growth.
"The easing of the LDR aligns with the bank’s guidance, which indicated that it would grow its loan book more cautiously."

This drop below the critical 100% mark signifies a strategic shift in HDFC Bank’s approach to lending post-merger.
newTitle: HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

title: India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
summary:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they hadn't held for eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

India's shortcomings both in batting consistency and strategic decisions ultimately led to their defeat in the prestigious Border Gavaskar Trophy series.
newTitle: India loses Border Gavaskar Trophy due to batting failures despite Bumrah's heroics

title: GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves | Check restrictions lifted - Hindustan Times
summary:
GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves

Date: Jan 05, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

The Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) has revoked the Stage III restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR due to improving air quality index (AQI) levels.

  • Stage III restrictions lifted due to favorable AQI trends.
  • Stage I and II measures still in effect, including a ban on non-essential construction work.
  • Classes up to grade 5 were previously shifted to a hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles in effect, with exceptions for persons with disabilities.
  • Strong advice remains to follow GRAP-II restrictions due to potential changing weather conditions.
"Owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and better wind speed, the AQI of Delhi has been continuously improving" - CAQM's order citing the India Meteorological Department.

This decision comes as the sub-committee will continue to monitor the air quality situation closely.
newTitle: GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves
